adrFormatAddress: 107 E 129th St, New York, NY 10035-1117, USA

originalText.text: I was a former employee here for MNMC, I’m writing this review not to bash Manhattan north or anyone associated with this company. I’m strictly shedding some light on a situation I was in while working here. Please beware of the HRA Payroll manager Ivelise Andino, she is very unprofessional and has very poor work etiquette. This lady likes to talk about the employees personal business with others within the company and humiliate/ bash co workers and gets upset when employees ask her to help out a tenant. She thinks because of her position she can downplay others. I advise everyone who wants to work here that she will make your stay unpleasant. I believe there are more empathetic and good natured people who take pride and honor in their career but she is definitely not one of them.

originalText.text: Horrible management!! I’ve had the worse experience dealing with Manhattan North Mgt!!!! Unprofessional, buildings are horrible, so glad I left !!! I would give no stars but that’s not an option !!

text.text: Horrible management!! I’ve had the worse experience dealing with Manhattan North Mgt!!!! Unprofessional, buildings are horrible, so glad I left !!! I would give no stars but that’s not an option !!

originalText.text: I contacted the Management Company on behalf of one of our Older Adult members who resides at one of their buildings here in Harlem. Two week ago the Management company informed me that they couldn't  locate her files and so they were unable to respond to my inquiry.  I have since contacted the  Management company on two (2) separate occasions and I also sent a detailed email regarding the inquiry.  As of today the Older Adult  haven't been given the curiosity of a phone  call or a response to to the email that was sent to them.  This is extremely unprofessional and inconsiderate to our older adults in our community. I plan to escalate this matter to the Department for the Aging and to our State Senator's office.

originalText.text:
I certainly can't speak for the entirety of their portfolio, but the building that I live in is very well-maintained. Our super is wonderful and always fixes things immediately. They have monthly pest control that actually stops by!

I've also found my conversations with the management team to always be helpful -- our washing machine broke recently and they were quick to replace it and give us a new one within less than a week. They are usually quick to respond via email but a little less reliable via phone.

I have had VERY bad experiences with past management companies in New York, so maybe my expectations are low, but I have lived in a few places and have found this company to be the best of the ones I have worked with. It is just one perspective, but wanted to share in light of all of the 1-star reviews.

originalText.text: The absolute worst. Took 1 year to get my tub glazed. Had issues with my tub, they only fixed it because it affected the unit under me. They did inspections for repairs 18 months ago and still haven't fixed anything. Just saw my rent receipt and they double charge me for February. 3 property managers in 2 years.  Had to get a cat to keep the mice away. You could literally hear the mice in the wall. The water is hot enough to cook noodles with.. Had to file a report with HPD. WILL CONTINUE TO FILE THEM.
